I believe this can be recreated by using the PaletteTemplateEntry constructor 
without ImageDescriptors.  e.g:

	PaletteTemplateEntry template = new PaletteTemplateEntry(
			TemplateConstants.TEMPLATE_HALF_ADDER,
		
	LogicMessages.LogicPlugin_Tool_CreationTool_HalfAdder_Label,
		
	LogicMessages.LogicPlugin_Tool_CreationTool_HalfAdder_Description);


I think setImage needs to check for null.

public void setImage(Image image) {
        if (image==null){
            return;
        }
	img = image;
	size = new Rectangle(image.getBounds()).getSize();
	revalidate();
	repaint();
}

Is null really a valid value?  How will your item appear in the "Icons Only" 
mode for the palette?

Good point,  I was doing some quick prototyping when I ran into the error.  

Why does PaletteTemplateEntry have a constructor without Images?
Good point.  That constructor should probably be protected, not public.

OK.  Thanks.  I have a neat tool that I'd like to write with GEF and I'm trying 
to get the hang of GEF.  

This is very cool.
